etymology.description: Depicts a stylized shape resembling a person sitting with hands folded -> associative with names, particularly in place names
etymology.interpretation: The character 邕(yōng, "name") visually represents a figure looking up with arms outstretched, which may relate to the notion of a name, historically used in place names like Nanning (formerly Yong Prefecture).

examples.chinese: 我们在图书馆遇见了邕(我們在圖書館遇見了邕)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài túshūguǎn yùjiàn le Yōng.
examples.english: We met Yōng at the library.

examples.chinese: 他的父母为邕感到骄傲(他的父母為邕感到驕傲)，因为邕勤奋好学(因為邕勤奮好學)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de fùmǔ wèi Yōng gǎndào jiāo'ào, yīnwèi Yōng qínfèn hàoxué.
examples.english: His parents are proud of Yōng because Yōng is diligent and studious.

examples.chinese: 诗人笔下的邕(詩人筆下的邕)，如流星般闪耀(如流星般閃耀)。
examples.pinyin: Shīrén bǐxià de Yōng, rú liúxīng bān shǎnyào.
examples.english: Yōng, as depicted by the poet, shines like a shooting star.
